posts.name: Justin Hollister
posts.cooked:
When we drive the robot we intermittently losing comms causing driver station to disable for a second. Almost always we can immediately re-enable and keep practicing but the issue has been around for a while and despite our best efforts we are stumped. We’re pretty certain its a comms issue as the ticker in the 5th tab of DS increases every time we disable. Anecdotally it seems that the disconnections grow more frequent when the robot is far away, aka far end of field, and when the battery is low.

Some of what we’ve tried so far :

Replacing Radio with one that we know works from last season-> nothing changed Replaced Roborio 1 with a Roborio 2 → seemed to reduce the frequency of the issue but did not solve it Replaced our REV color sensor with a CAN TOF sensor as we heard issues with I2C could cause comms → did not change anything Replaced most of our ethernet cables → nothing changed Switched from using the RPM to powering the radio through a vrm → seemed to reduce the frequency of the issue but did not solve it While recreating issue we constantly ran a ping -t at the radio which didn’t report lost packets even when we lost comms → makes us think the issue is between the radio and rio but have not verified yet

Other information: We are using a brainbox ethernet switch and two limelights The brain box is powered through the REV MPM

I don’t have access to logs currently but should be able to get some tomorrow or the day after. Lately we’ve found it difficult to recreate the issue in shop, but when we go to another team’s practice field which they kindly let us use, we lose comms much more frequently.

Any help would be greatly appreciated! Thank you!

link_counts.title: Driver Station Losing Communication with Robot

posts.name: Nolan Locke
posts.cooked:
We were having disconnects at our regional last weekend, and today we discovered that one of the ports on the brainboxes switch was loose in the housing and had a bent pin. We haven’t been able to test it again yet, but are fairly confident that this was the problem.

posts.cooked: Brainbox Ethernet Switch Question / Match Issues Electrical

link_counts.title: Brainbox Ethernet Switch Question / Match Issues

posts.name: Caleb Pohlman
posts.cooked: Our team is looking into static electricity, as we are having problems like this and have changed all of the part on the robot other then the pdh.

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: Have you tried different laptops.    We have one that while practicing will disconnect and disable frequently and another that won’t.  The network hardware or software may be faulty on the drive laptop.

posts.name: Caleb Pohlman
posts.cooked: Yes, 2 laptop that are the same spec though

posts.name: Caleb Pohlman
posts.cooked: Here is the video showing the static build up. https://youtube.com/shorts/tYl_2eiSpJk?si=tdG4_QBkNo7a55rZ

posts.name: Scott W
posts.cooked: Have you tried replacing the SW-005 switch with a different brand and model of network switch?  That worked for us.

posts.name: Caleb Pohlman
posts.cooked: during this test we were using D-Link 5-Port Fast Ethernet Desktop Switch (GO-SW-5E)

We’ve had the exact same problem - and, as others have reported: switching to a RoboRio 2 definitely lowered the frequency, though it still happens sometimes; and it happens on some computers but not others.

posts.name: Caleb Pohlman
posts.cooked: How many notes are you shooting/intaking in a game?

posts.name: Justin Hollister
posts.cooked: I was under the impression the MPM served the same purpose as a VRM . We’ll try plugging the brainbox in there, and if that doesn’t work we’ll probably try with a different network switch. Is there another switch you recommend? I thought brainbox was the recommended one.

posts.name: Brandon McDonald
posts.cooked: Are you up to date with the latest Ni Tools and WPILib versions?

posts.name: Justin Hollister
posts.cooked: If I remember correctly we have 2024 of both but might not have the latest patches.

posts.name: Brandon McDonald
posts.cooked: Try to update Ni Tools and see if that helps, i had a similar issue earlier in the season and an update fixed it for me

posts.name: Jsteel
posts.cooked:
We believe we narrowed our problem down to the Brainbox.  At our second competition, when we had reached the end of our frustration limit, we wired around the Brianbix and the problem disappeared for the rest of the competition.

We are going to try another switch, as we really would like to be using two Limlights, and without the switch we only have one.
